name: Suggestion for a build with max DMG over time
author: Iotivedo

posts.author: Iotivedo
posts.content:
Hello, I play in a server where in the end game we have no problem with def.
Then I'm looking for a build that take care only of max DMG for round or that I can use to start developing my own.
Thanks in advance.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
We will need a bit more information here.

Things like - how is TS (True Sight) - vanilla or nerfed?  Crit immunes/Sneak Immunes?  Arrow Replicators available?  Dev Crit nerfed?  Class restrictions?

Things like that.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello lotivedo - welcome to the Guild!

Hope you don't mind, but I've moved this into the Build Request forum because it seems to be one - and because you're more likely to get the help you want here.

Can I ask a few questions before we get to the bones of it?
Does your server use vanilla rules, spells, etc? How about the environment (by which I mean +5, +10 gear and such, or higher/lower than that)? Is it PvM or PvP? Is it Dev Crit enabled? And what's the max level you're likely to achieve? The more details the better.

More broadly, are you looking for a melee or ranged type, a caster, a sneaker, or a spellsword? Does alignment make any difference to you?

My initial thoughts when you say "max DMG for round", is that a smiter might be your best bet, but some more information from your good self would be helpful first.

Cheers

EDIT: Ninja'd by Web again! (You're just lurking until I'm about to post now, aren't you? Paranoia is a thing, you know!)

posts.content: I can see when you type on your keyboard...

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I've done a lot of experimenting with minmaxing damage for the server I currently play on, and unfortunately it's a lot more complex than just coming up with build ideas. The first time I made a full damage calc I tested more than 80 builds, and that was only for 5 different bosses. Even small changes such as switching weapons or swapping 2 STR for 2 CHA on Divine Might builds can make a significant difference to the damage you do. Another factor is that certain types of builds (such as melee, ranged, DIvine Might users, etc) are better in certain situations, but you're probably already aware of that.

This is a list of the variables you would need to know if you want to completely minmax average damage per round against a specific opponent:
Target - AC, Damage Immunity, Damage Resistance, Damage Reduction, Critical Immunity, Sneak Attack Immunity, Concealment, Epic Dodge, and Deflect Arrows (for ranged builds).
Your build - AB, Threat Range, Damage Types, Sneak Attack Die, Normal Damage Roll, Critical Damage Roll, Blind Fight.
By "Normal Damage Roll" and "Critical Damage Roll" I mean everything excluding Sneak Attack damage, so that includes base weapon damage, any bonus damage on your weapon, Massive Criticals either from the weapon or from Overwhelming Critical, and things like Bane Of Enemies or Divine Might. If your build dual-wields then you will need to include the information for the offhand weapon too.
You would need to know this information for every build you test and every target you face. This is excluding any custom features or weapon effects that your server might have, it can become even more complex once you include those.

Since you're playing on a server that goes up to level 60 I'm assuming that there are probably other custom features, but in vanilla NWN the main classes to focus on for maximising damage are:
Bard, Cler, Figh, Monk, Pal, Rang, Rog, AA, Ass, BG, CoT, RDD, and WM.
You might need to get other classes for requirements or playability, but if you're focusing purely on damage then those are the classes you should focus on.

With Critical Immunity and Sneak Attack Immunity being common, I would recommend something along the lines of a STR/CHA Rang/Pal/Monk or STR/CHA Rang/Cler/Monk that dual wields kamas and uses Divine Might to bypass DI/DR. If +8 EB weapons are available then you can self-buff close to the AB cap, and Bane will give you extra AB and damage against FEs. This is just a rough idea though, since you've actually played on the server you probably know what works better than I do.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Here are some ideas for simpler, consistent, good-but-not-max-damage builds:

Fighter / Bard / RDD will hit hard.  Using a heavy flail will give you 1.5 times the strength damage bonus because it is a 2-handed weapon, and it will deal the seldom-resisted blunt damage. You could either go Bard-heavy for a stronger song or Fighter-heavy for a better BAB and more feats.

Monk / Sorcerer 1 / RDD with dual kamas will hit hard with up to 9 attacks per round.

Fighter / Monk / WM with lots of WM with dual kamas will hit up to 10 times a round with a higher AB and more critical hits.

Fighter / Rogue / WM will be able to add sneak attack damage, using Knockdown to generate sneaks.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I've made a minmaxed Figh14/WM25/Monk1 for the server BSK, it has the best damage you can get from a Figh/WM/Monk with DevCrit. [https://blackstonekeep.com/viewtopic.php?f=25&t=3591]

It's built for a server with +20 AB weapons and monsters that can be crit, a Rang/Pal/Monk or Rang/Cler/Monk will probably have a higher AB and a higher damage against crit immune enemies. This build has Dev Crit but it doesn't have Blind Fight, so you should either drop Dev Crit or switch to a Figh16/WM22/Monk2 and get Blind Fight with the extra Fighter feat. It doesn't have UMD or caster classes, so if UMD is needed to buff on your server then you will struggle when playing solo.

posts.content:
I would suggest The Fighting Kama build :
SpoilerFighting Kama With Empty body active it's possible to sneak up on nearly any enemy then strike with Quivering palm. Sometimes this will end a fight before it even starts. A periapt of wisdom makes this even more likely. Creatures that are immune to critical hits are often overwhelmed quickly just by the sheer number of attacks she's able to dish out. Feats : levels 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 33, 36, and 39 (1 extra Human) Weapon Master : Dodge, Mobility, Expertise, Spring Attack, WF, Whirlwind Attack, Intimidate 4 Monk : Bonus feats every 5 levels after level 20. Race: Elf Starting stats: DEX = 15 WIS = 15 (18) CHA = 8 Level progression: Monk 1 Fighter 4 Boost Discipline during WM levels 1 F1 Dodge, Mobility 3 M1 Power Attack 5 M2 7 F5 9 M4 Spring Attack (Go F6 here!!!) 11 M6 13 WM1 WoC Kama 15 WM3 Ambidexterity 17 WM5 19 WM7 21 F6 EFW:Kama, EWS:Kama 23 M10 25 M12 27 M14 ICrit:Kama 29 M16 31 M18 33 M20 OC:Kama 35 M22 37 M24 39 M26 great WIS I Make use of saving skill points throughout character development. posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I tested 4 minmaxed builds against every AC value that matters for both crit immune and non-crit immune enemies. I assumed that all builds had +12 STR/CHA, were hasted, were using either plain +8 EB kamas or keened +8 EB kamas, and that the opponent had no DI/DR.

The builds were: Figh14/WM25/Monk1, Rang26/Cler13/Monk1, Rang35/Figh4/Monk1, and Rang26/Pal13/Monk1.
The Rang26/Cler13/Monk1 out-damages the other builds against all opponents, whether they're immune to critical hits or not, and regardless of whether the kamas are keened or not.

This doesn't factor in things like time to rebuff, Epic Dodge, or concealment, so it's possible that one of the other builds is situationally better than the Rang26/Cler13/Monk1. This was also just a test of these four builds, it's likely that other builds will out-damage a Rang26/Cler13/Monk1 against some opponents.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I haven't posted it anywhere since it's just a quick minmaxed build, I'll post a rough version here.

Even as somebody who only plays optimised level 40 builds, fully minmaxed builds are not something I actually recommend playing. The basic Rang/Cler/Monk concept can (and should) be edited into a more balanced and playable build, but since this is purely about damage I haven't bothered. It's a melee DPS build made to be part of a balanced level 40 PvM party, if you want to do a lot of damage when solo then choose a more playable build.

The class spread is a choice between Rang26/Cler13/Monk1 and Rang26/Cler12/Monk2. Rang26/Cler12/Monk2 gets Deflect Arrows and is more playable but Rang26/Cler13/Monk1 has better Cleric spells so I went with that spread. Despite having 13 Cleric levels it can't cast level 7 Cleric spells due to the low WIS, changing this requires either dropping Dev Crit or lowering STR. For domains I went with Trickery and War, but Animal (for level 3 True Seeing) and Healing (for level 5 Heal) are decent alternatives too.

This build ends with 30STR/16CHA, but 28STR/18CHA and 26STR/20CHA are both valid ending abilities. Since this is just a rough build I only tested the highest STR variant, whether higher STR or higher CHA is better depends on your opponent anyway. A 9 CHA modifier means your Divine Might matches up with your Extended Divine Favor when recasting, but ultimately it doesn't really matter since perfect timing in the middle of combat is very difficult.

All four of the tested builds had Dev Crit, you can free up some feats in this build by dropping it. A fully minmaxed version has 5 Favored Enemies and is only meant to be used against those 5 FEs. You can edit it to have up to 8 FEs, but at that point it's not fully minmaxed. I don't know which FEs are useful on your server so you will have to choose the 5 most important FEs.

By rearranging skill points you can get enough Set Trap for epic traps, but I didn't bother because it's made for hitting hard rather than strategy. Since this is just a rough build I haven't bothered with a full skill progression.

Buffs: Aid (+1 AB for 26 turns), Bless (+1 AB for 13 turns), Extended Prayer (+1 AB, +1 Physical Damage for 26 rounds), Extended Battletide (+2 AB, +2 Magical Damage for 26 rounds), Extended Divine Favor (+4 AB, +4 Magical Damage for 2 turns), War Domain (+3 AB, +3 Physical Damage for 14 rounds), Divine Might (+9 Divine Damage for 9 rounds).
Total: +12 AB, +4 Physical Damage, +9 Divine Damage, +6 Magical Damage.
Both the Divine and Magical Damage bypass DI/DR, so that's a minimum of 15 damage against anything you hit.
When using +8 EB kamas while War Domain is active you will be at the +20 AB cap, once it wears off you only have +17 AB. I didn't include War Domain when doing the damage calc because it has a short duration and can't be recast, so even without War Domain the build still out-damages alternative minmaxed builds.

Again, this is a build that is fully minmaxed for damage. If you want something more playable then you will either need to edit it or choose a different build.

===

Class: Ranger 26 / Cleric 13 / Monk 1
Race: Human
Alignment: Any Lawful
Playability: 37-40 PvM

STR: 16 (30)
DEX: 8
CON: 8
WIS: 16
INT: 8
CHA: 16

21: Cleric(1): Divine Might, Domain Trickery, Domain War

29: Cleric(4)

34: Cleric(9)
35: Cleric(10)

37: Monk(1)
38: Cleric(12)
39: Cleric(13): Great Strength IV, (STR=29)
40: Ranger(26): STR+1, Epic Prowess, (STR=30)

Animal Empathy 1(4), Concentration 43(42), Disable Trap 1(0), Discipline 43(53), Open Lock 1(0), Pick Pocket 1(0), Set Trap 1(0), Spellcraft 12(11), Tumble 40(39)
